commit_message:
Adds IPv6 support for interface_for_ip function

Proper interface matching when an IPv6 address is provided.

If Facter version used is < 3 then it adds the netmask6 facts as custom facts.

Fix bugs https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1280523

Change-Id: Ide26ca1740dc12ea5f47a28f4cecacd6ef0b18f9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-tripleo refs/changes/43/245643/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ip1 = IPAddr.new(arg[0]) next if interface == '.' || interface == '..' if ip1.ipv4? ipaddress_name = "ipaddress_#{iface_no_dash}" netmask_name = "netmask_#{iface_no_dash}" else ipaddress_name = "ipaddress6_#{iface_no_dash}" netmask_name = "netmask6_#{iface_no_dash}" end interface_ip = lookupvar(ipaddress_name) netmask = lookupvar(netmask_name) unless interface_ip.nil? then ip2 = IPAddr.new(interface_ip) return interface if ip1.mask(netmask) == ip2.mask(netmask)
deleted_lines: ip_to_find = arg[0] next if interface == '.' or interface == '..' interface_ip = lookupvar("ipaddress_#{iface_no_dash}") netmask = lookupvar("netmask_#{iface_no_dash}") if not interface_ip.nil? then ip1=IPAddr.new(interface_ip) ip2=IPAddr.new(ip_to_find) if ip1.mask(netmask) == ip2.mask(netmask) then return interface end

Change-Id: I95f6bfaf9f4a33bf805ef82ddb5244d8662f1009

commit_message:
Create indirection API for versioned objects

To make full use of versioned objects we need to enable RPC calls
using them. This is role of indirection API.

blueprint indirection-api

Change-Id: I95f6bfaf9f4a33bf805ef82ddb5244d8662f1009
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-specs refs/changes/54/176654/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ====================================== Indirection api for versioned objects ====================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/heat/+spec/indirection-api To make futher use of versioned objects, we need to use indirection API. Indirection API is RPC middleware which turns calls to RPC with versioning. This will be equivalent to nova.conductor.rpcapi.ConductorAPI. Problem description =================== To truly make use of versioned objects we need to include so called indirection API. This means we need to include class which will turn versioned objects calls to RPC calls with versioning. This will enable @remotable decorator from versionedobjects to perform RPC calls. Side effect of this work will be much more RPC calls and better scallability of heat itself. Proposed change =============== Create new module called heat.objects.indirection_api which will be heat equivalent to nova.conductor.rpcapi.ConductorAPI. Each remotable method will have its counterpart in this API, and therefore will be callable over RPC. First methods to turn to remotable will be create, update and delete methods of Stack and Resource objects. Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: inc007 Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: liberty-1 Work Items ---------- * Basic indirection mechanism * Changes to HeatObject to use our indirection API as default * Create proxy methods for Stack * Create proxy methods for Resource Dependencies ============ None

Use tags in the dnsmasq for HTTP boot

Use tags in the dnsmasq instead old 'net' method to support
multirack feature.

Make tests properly use object_class_action_versions()

This also includes a new test to validate that the fallback behavior
still works.

Change-Id: Id85cbd837774a8fe8ec4f0631f57c3421cef54e4

added_lines: @mock.patch('oslo_versionedobjects.base.obj_tree_get_versions') def test_indirection_class_action(self, mock_otgv): mock_otgv.return_value = mock.sentinel.versions 'object_class_action_versions') as mock_caction: mock.sentinel.versions, @mock.patch('oslo_versionedobjects.base.obj_tree_get_versions') def test_major_version_mismatch(self, mock_otgv): mock_otgv.return_value = {'MyObj': '2.0'} @mock.patch('oslo_versionedobjects.base.obj_tree_get_versions') def test_minor_version_greater(self, mock_otgv): mock_otgv.return_value = {'MyObj': '1.7'} @mock.patch('oslo_versionedobjects.base.obj_tree_get_versions') def test_minor_version_less(self, mock_otgv): mock_otgv.return_value = {'MyObj': '1.2'} @mock.patch('oslo_versionedobjects.base.obj_tree_get_versions') def test_compat(self, mock_otgv): mock_otgv.return_value = {'MyObj': '1.1'} @mock.patch('oslo_versionedobjects.base.obj_tree_get_versions') def test_revision_ignored(self, mock_otgv): mock_otgv.return_value = {'MyObj': '1.1.456'} def test_class_action_falls_back_compat(self): with mock.patch.object(base.VersionedObject, 'indirection_api') as ma: ma.object_class_action_versions.side_effect = NotImplementedError MyObj.query(self.context) ma.object_class_action.assert_called_once_with( self.context, 'MyObj', 'query', MyObj.VERSION, (), {})

commit_message:
Make class action calls use version manifest

This follows the object_backport_versions() change by also making the
class action calls pass a version manifest. This is done in a compatible
way by first trying the new method, and if unsupported, falling back
to the original method.

No tests are changed here specifically to demonstrate that they are
undisturbed by this change. Proper tests are next.

Change-Id: If9a158fbd345b56b26ebbe2a0733db55f4929ea1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.versionedobjects refs/changes/61/224861/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: version_manifest = obj_tree_get_versions(cls.obj_name()) try: result = cls.indirection_api.object_class_action_versions( context, cls.obj_name(), fn.__name__, version_manifest, args, kwargs) except NotImplementedError: # FIXME(danms): Maybe start to warn here about deprecation? result = cls.indirection_api.object_class_action( context, cls.obj_name(), fn.__name__, cls.VERSION, args, kwargs) def object_class_action_versions(self, context, objname, objmethod, object_versions, args, kwargs): """Perform an action on a VersionedObject class. When indirection_api is set on a VersionedObject (to a class implementing this interface), classmethod calls on remotable_classmethod methods will cause this to be executed to actually make the desired call. This usually involves performing RPC. :param context: The context within which to perform the action :param objname: The registry name of the object :param objmethod: The name of the action method to call :param object_versions: A dict of {objname: version} mappings :param args: The positional arguments to the action method :param kwargs: The keyword arguments to the action method :returns: The result of the action method, which may (or may not) be an instance of the implementing VersionedObject class. """ raise NotImplementedError('Multi-version class action not supported')
deleted_lines: result = cls.indirection_api.object_class_action( context, cls.obj_name(), fn.__name__, cls.VERSION, args, kwargs)

commit_message:
Disable suggestion of v1 help for v2 commands

Currently the client suggests 'Run `glance --os-image-api-version 1
help` for v1 help' at the end of every help message. This is could
be confusing for a v2 only command.

Therefore this patch disables it if the command does not exist in v1,
while keeping the message on the 'glance help' results.

Change-Id: I967e9ba35afb8dc40524bd1d13284e684b435f81
Closes-Bug: 1520602

commit_message:
Adding volume object to manage snapshot API

This adds the volume object to the parameters that are passed
to driver manage_existing_snapshot APIs. This allows for more
information about the potential parent volume of the snapshot
to be compared against.

Some drivers may not want a snapshot to be managable to a volume
if the status of the volume is in certain states, such as
the 'failed-over' state from replication. The volume object
contains the status. Also it allows verification that the volume
is the correct parent for the snapshot as some drivers may want
snapshots to only be manageable by the correct parent volumes.

Closes-Bug: #1528354
Change-Id: I67950c8867bc0a4d19263baa7c12cf99ae046d84

commit_message:
Adapt iPXE template to work with UEFI

This patch is adapting the iPXE template to work with BIOS and UEFI
mode.

It's passing the boot_mode= kernel parameter accordingly to the mode
being booted and explicitly passing initrd=deploy_ramdisk because it's
required for iPXE with UEFI [0]

[0] http://forum.ipxe.org/showthread.php?tid=7589&pid=11843#pid11843

Change-Id: I174536a04ff3f0266e9e7eee909ad752d44c0bce
Closes-Bug: #1525989

Change-Id: I48d3e52cb0f051e6e20fd57e3d9f15e8db1c99aa
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-10-29 13:56:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent/commit/f04c6670467fd9e3b03ed493163fa4eefb7f2d70', 'message': 'WIP: Show md(4) devices in Fuel UI

Change-Id: I48d3e52cb0f051e6e20fd57e3d9f15e8db1c99aa
'}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2015-11-30 10:14:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent/commit/bd1a6c63a862b28083b09c3a5fe8f2a06ef907b9', 'message': "Show fake raid devices in Fuel UI

In order to allow nailgun-agent find out fake raid devices:
* MD with 'Raid Level' set to 'container' need to be found,
* undelaying devices from that MD should be filtered out from
  storage devices.

So, if /dev/md127 exists and is actually a contaner, then
* nailgun agent should skip it from reporting as container
  device can't be used as a block device,
* underlaying devices from that container (say, /dev/sda and /dev/sdb)
  shouldn't be reported as storage devices. Logic is simple,
  those devices can't be used too, as they're a part of MD.
* only actual MD (say, /dev/md126) which represent fake raid
  will be reported as a storage device.

Change-Id: I48d3e52cb0f051e6e20fd57e3d9f15e8db1c99aa

commit_message:
Show fake raid devices in Fuel UI

In order to allow nailgun-agent find out fake raid devices:
* MD with 'Raid Level' set to 'container' need to be found,
* undelaying devices from that MD should be filtered out from
  storage devices.

So, if /dev/md127 exists and is actually a contaner, then
* nailgun agent should skip it from reporting as container
  device can't be used as a block device,
* underlaying devices from that container (say, /dev/sda and /dev/sdb)
  shouldn't be reported as storage devices. Logic is simple,
  those devices can't be used too, as they're a part of MD.
* only actual MD (say, /dev/md126) which represent fake raid
  will be reported as a storage device.

Change-Id: I48d3e52cb0f051e6e20fd57e3d9f15e8db1c99aa
Co-Authored-By: Serhii Lystopad <slystopad@mirantis.com>
Related-Bug: #1508908

Add owner validation for "openstack image create/set"

Owner validation is necessary if a new image owner
will be created/set.

commit_message:
Use TimeFixture from oslo_utils to override time in tests

Instead of calling timeutils.set_time_override() directly where one
also has to remember to call timeutils.clear_time_override() when done
or potentially interfere with other tests, lets use the provided
fixture in oslo timeutils that handle all of this for us.

Also replace a few occurances where timeutils.utcnow() was mocked just
to provide some consistency in how time overrides are done.

Change-Id: Ice5bdb3fa3dc57ba8bafba702f2070fba7457ea7

commit_message:
Start rename of BLATHER -> TRACE

This appears to be standardizing around the name
TRACE instead of BLATHER so start to move taskflow
internally to use this name instead.

Change-Id: I095039ac556eb07b821a29528b1b76651bcbab5c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/52/258752/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Add a BLATHER/TRACE level, this matches the multiprocessing # utils.py module (and oslo.log, kazoo and others) that declares a similar # level, this level is for information that is even lower level than regular # DEBUG and gives out so much runtime information that it is only # useful by low-level/certain users...TRACE = BLATHER def trace(self, msg, *args, **kwargs): """Delegate a trace call to the underlying logger.""" self.log(TRACE, msg, *args, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: # Add a BLATHER level, this matches the multiprocessing utils.py module (and # kazoo and others) that declares a similar level, this level is for # information that is even lower level than regular DEBUG and gives out so # much runtime information that it is only useful by low-level/certain users...

Add maximum disk, vcpu and memory requirement

a flavor requirement.
This commit enables this opportunity.

commit_message:
Add SoftwareConfigTransport for switching transports

This change adds a SoftwareConfigTransport parameter to role templates
so that the transport can be changed via a parameter_defaults entry.

Changing the transport to POLL_TEMP_URL on an existing overcloud has
worked for local testing when heat change
I9c475f0c489c67db5895924050186228403f2773 is running on the undercloud.

Change-Id: I5c2a2d2170714093c5757282cba12ac65f8738a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/93/250593/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: SoftwareConfigTransport: default: POLL_SERVER_CFN description: | How the server should receive the metadata required for software configuration. type: string constraints: - allowed_values: [POLL_SERVER_CFN, POLL_SERVER_HEAT, POLL_TEMP_URL, ZAQAR_MESSAGE] software_config_transport: {get_param: SoftwareConfigTransport}

commit_message:
Change status to DISABLED if admin_state_up if false

If a resource's admin_state_up is false, the status should be DISABLED.
This patch changes pool, vip, member, health_monitor all together.

Change-Id: I659a0b5ee602edcf18584c55f94ceca2b886224f
Closes-Bug: #1519664
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/75/255875/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if member['admin_state_up']: self.plugin_rpc.update_status('vip', vip['id'], np_const.ACTIVE) else: self.plugin_rpc.update_status('vip', vip['id'], np_const.INACTIVE) if pool['admin_state_up']: self.plugin_rpc.update_status('pool', pool['id'], np_const.ACTIVE) else: self.plugin_rpc.update_status('pool', pool['id'], np_const.INACTIVE) if member['admin_state_up']: self.plugin_rpc.update_status('member', member['id'], np_const.ACTIVE) else: self.plugin_rpc.update_status('member', member['id'], np_const.INACTIVE) if health_monitor['admin_state_up']: self.plugin_rpc.update_status( 'health_monitor', assoc_id, np_const.ACTIVE) else: self.plugin_rpc.update_status( 'health_monitor', assoc_id, np_const.INACTIVE)
deleted_lines: self.plugin_rpc.update_status('vip', vip['id'], np_const.ACTIVE) self.plugin_rpc.update_status('pool', pool['id'], np_const.ACTIVE) self.plugin_rpc.update_status('member', member['id'], np_const.ACTIVE) self.plugin_rpc.update_status( 'health_monitor', assoc_id, np_const.ACTIVE)

commit_message:
Update KloudBuster Image to v5

name: kloudbuster_v5
image name: kloudbuster_v5.qcow2
image-url: https://cisco.box.com/shared/static/9sc3vzqm5jrrtb5nvrrb5wmluutv9mci.qcow2
(please copy to http://storage.apps.openstack.org/images, and remove
the old kloudbuster_v4.qcow2 image)
hash: 9d51ac7d0ea465d9a42b5bd5e38ceb5e (same as in the patch)

Change-Id: I8993ece208627e9be2b1dbd032162b4545eb4c33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/app-catalog refs/changes/59/259659/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: name: kloudbuster_v5 VM image version 5 needed for any KloudBuster scale testing. KloudBuster provides a quick and easy way to load any OpenStack data plane with massive HTTP scale (hundreds of thousands of flows) on any size of cloud and measure the scale very accurately. This image is launched by the KloudBuster application in potentially large number of VMs. Starting from v5, KloudBuster image has a Web UI built-in which can be directly launched by the user, the same as launching a regular cloud image. The Web UI implements 90% of the KloudBuster features, along with a very straight forward and user friendly interface. Refer to our documents for the instructions to run KloudBuster, as well as the video tutorial. This image is based off Ubuntu 14.04.3 with pre-installed software required to run the KloudBuster scale test: KloudBuster agent, Redis server, Nginx HTTP server, wrk2 HTTP traffic generator. VM instances are created with this image by KloudBuster to perform the various roles of a scale session (HTTP server, HTTP clients, Redis server). For more information, refer to the documentation. url: http://storage.apps.openstack.org/images/kloudbuster_v5.qcow2 hash: 9d51ac7d0ea465d9a42b5bd5e38ceb5e
deleted_lines: name: kloudbuster_v4 VM image version 4 needed for any KloudBuster scale testing. This image is launched by the KloudBuster application in potentially large number of VM instances. It is not designed to be launched directly by the user. KloudBuster provides a quick and easy way to load any OpenStack data plane with massive HTTP scale (hundreds of thousands of flows) on any size of cloud and measure the scale very accurately. This image is based off Ubuntu 14.04 with pre-installed software required to run the KloudBuster scale test: kloudbuster agent, Redis server, Nginx HTTP server, wrk2 HTTP traffic generator. VM instances are created with this image by KloudBuster to perform the various roles of a scale session (HTTP server, HTTP clients, Redis server). For more information, refer to the documentation. url: http://storage.apps.openstack.org/images/kloudbuster_v4.qcow2 hash: 4eec3a8c954121fa89774fd1b192242b

commit_message:
Fix placements of docs, samples, certification in the Dockerfile

Now all task samples, docs and certification related files moved
into /opt/rally/. Add proper info in the docs. Add message of the
day to say about certification, samples and docs allocation to user.

Change-Id: Ic0b36c80ddf04efcc92c816ee012f7c4fe955142

subject: Errors in docker registry configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-21 02:52:34.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/templates/kubernetes/fragments/configure-docker-registry.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum/commit/e83470cbc9905ee581673250b587a71731b5f635', 'message': "Errors in docker registry configuration

1. Add a colon after version. It is a syntax error.
2. Correct the name of docker registry config file.
3. Add double quotation marks around string parameters. If we don't
add them and the string is composed of numbers, docker registry
reports errors.

[1]https://github.com/docker/distribution/blob/master/docs/
configuration.md#overriding-the-entire-configuration-file

Closes-Bug: #1528075
Change-Id: I2001415bc54becdccc7d28592a025c3786187fb3
"}]
commit_message:
Errors in docker registry configuration

1. Add a colon after version. It is a syntax error.
2. Correct the name of docker registry config file.
3. Add double quotation marks around string parameters. If we don't
add them and the string is composed of numbers, docker registry
reports errors.

[1]https://github.com/docker/distribution/blob/master/docs/
configuration.md#overriding-the-entire-configuration-file

Closes-Bug: #1528075
Change-Id: I2001415bc54becdccc7d28592a025c3786187fb3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/27/259827/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cat > /etc/sysconfig/registry-config.yml << EOF version: 0.1 authurl: "$REGISTRY_AUTH_URL" region: "$REGISTRY_REGION" username: "$REGISTRY_USERNAME" password: "$REGISTRY_PASSWORD" domain: "$REGISTRY_DOMAIN" trustid: "$REGISTRY_TRUST_ID" container: "$REGISTRY_CONTAINER" addr: :5000ExecStart=/usr/bin/docker run -d -p $REGISTRY_PORT:5000 --restart=always --name registry -v /etc/sysconfig/registry-config.yml:/etc/docker/registry/config.yml registry:2
deleted_lines: cat > /etc/sysconfig/registry-config.yaml << EOF version 0.1 authurl: $REGISTRY_AUTH_URL region: $REGISTRY_REGION username: $REGISTRY_USERNAME password: $REGISTRY_PASSWORD domain: $REGISTRY_DOMAIN trustid: $REGISTRY_TRUST_ID container: $REGISTRY_CONTAINER addr: localhost:5000ExecStart=/usr/bin/docker run -d -p $REGISTRY_PORT:5000 --restart=always --name registry -v /etc/sysconfig/registry-config.yaml:/etc/docker/registry/config.yaml registry:2

commit_message:
Allow to re-run keystone_bootstrap

It checks if keystone was already bootstrapped and if so, it exits
boostrap container right after database migration.

Change-Id: Id9fd145851ea0561d86b1c59ac033ca437de2529
Closes-Bug: 1483259
Partially-Implements: blueprint upgrade-keystone
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/67/257567/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check if there is keystone running and it was already bootstrapped set +e bootstrapped=`openstack user list 2>&1 | grep admin`; error=`echo $?` set -e if [ $error -eq 0 ] && [ bootstrapped ]; then echo "Keystone already bootstrapped. Exiting." exit 0 fi

commit_message:
Add -constraints sections for CI jobs

Tox does not currently support using factors with sections, and work
towards enabling this has stalled, as such we will need to duplicate
sections adding -constraints to facilitate running sections with the
constrained install_command.

Implements Blueprint: Requirements-Management

Depends-On: I59fcf763d7eb9252e950dce5783befc20b4e8fd4
Change-Id: Icbbb78cfcd074b0050e60c54557637af723f9b92
(cherry picked from commit a42e53a8a7a9aacbfffbcfb2c3b9a606487d438b)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/05/248505/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: constraints: {[testenv:common-constraints]install_command}[testenv:common-constraints] install_command = pip install -c{env:UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE:https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/requirements/plain/upper-constraints.txt?h=stable/liberty} {opts} {packages} [testenv:pep8-constraints] install_command = {[testenv:common-constraints]install_command} commands = bash tools/flake8wrap.sh {posargs} [testenv:py34-constraints] install_command = {[testenv:common-constraints]install_command} setenv = {[testenv]setenv} deps = -r{toxinidir}/requirements.txt -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = {[testenv:py34]commands} [testenv:functional-constraints] usedevelop = {[testenv:functional]usedevelop} install_command = {[testenv:common-constraints]install_command} setenv = {[testenv:functional]setenv} commands = find . -type f -name "*.pyc" -delete bash tools/pretty_tox.sh '{posargs}' [testenv:cover-constraints] install_command = {[testenv:common-constraints]install_command} # Also do not run test_coverage_ext tests while gathering coverage as those # tests conflict with coverage. commands = coverage erase python setup.py testr --coverage \ --testr-args='{posargs}' coverage combine coverage html --include='nova/*' --omit='nova/openstack/common/*' -d covhtml -i [testenv:venv-constraints] install_command = {[testenv:common-constraints]install_command} commands = {posargs} [testenv:docs-constraints] install_command = {[testenv:common-constraints]install_command} commands = {[testenv:docs]commands}

subject: Manage Keystone_endpoint and Keystone_service without warnings by default
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-21 13:00:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/91dcbfaf84865de28ecdaf624c798ad456f8cdf1', 'message': "Manage Keystone_endpoint and Keystone_service without warnings by default

A recent change (1] made Keystone_endpoint matching service by name/type.
This change added a warning if endpoints were not created with a default
service.
The way this new feature was added is problematic because we had
warnings by default, since all Puppet modules use this define, so it
introduced a poor user experience.

This patch makes sure a service type is configured with the new way in
the keystone::resource::service_identity function, when creating
endpoint.
For backward compatibility, when no service type is specified, we have now a
conditional that sends a warning if no service type is set but still
create the endpoints.
For the service management, it adds the service type with the new way,
so we don't have any warning by default.

So from this patch, we don't have this kind of warning by default:
/Keystone_endpoint[RegionOne/keystone]/type: Support for a endpoint
without the type set is deprecated in Liberty. It will be dropped in
Mitaka

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/?id=0a4e06abb0f5b3f324464ff5219d2885816311ce

Change-Id: I6e411d8f81c7ae5c768d85a236c0942d265c74dd

commit_message:
Manage Keystone_endpoint and Keystone_service without warnings by default

A recent change (1] made Keystone_endpoint matching service by name/type.
This change added a warning if endpoints were not created with a default
service.
The way this new feature was added is problematic because we had
warnings by default, since all Puppet modules use this define, so it
introduced a poor user experience.

This patch makes sure a service type is configured with the new way in
the keystone::resource::service_identity function, when creating
endpoint.
For backward compatibility, when no service type is specified, we have now a
conditional that sends a warning if no service type is set but still
create the endpoints.
For the service management, it adds the service type with the new way,
so we don't have any warning by default.

So from this patch, we don't have this kind of warning by default:
/Keystone_endpoint[RegionOne/keystone]/type: Support for a endpoint
without the type set is deprecated in Liberty. It will be dropped in
Mitaka

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/?id=0a4e06abb0f5b3f324464ff5219d2885816311ce

Closes-Bug: #1528308
Change-Id: I6e411d8f81c7ae5c768d85a236c0942d265c74dd

commit_message:
Align python requirements with centos repo

* add a test for requirements.txt
* fix imports for oslo_config and oslo_serialization
* pin minimal version of oslo.config and oslo.serialization
* update packages rules and specs

Change-Id: I4f1caca22fb4de3350fdbf28dae3fffe8d88326c
Closes-Bug: #1481297

commit_message:
Syntax changes for use of pip_install

Syntax changes for consistency as follows:
- Change parameter=value syntax to parameter: value in
pip_install.yml
- Change "== false" to "| bool == false", also for
consistency.

Change-Id: I728b44243910c7c5556df529e1a3291655903883
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/19/260219/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pip: name: "{{ package }}" state: "{{ state | default(omit) }}" version: "{{ version | default(omit) }}" virtualenv: "{{ virtualenv | default(omit) }}" when: source_install is not defined or (source_install | bool == false)
deleted_lines: pip: name="{{ package }}" state="{{ state | default(omit) }}" version="{{ version | default(omit) }}" virtualenv="{{ virtualenv | default(omit) }}" when: source_install is not defined or source_install == false

commit_message:
Add new options to fuel-bootstrap-cli build command

Currently some options are merged with options by default.
Default options can be skipped by using new flags.

Change-Id: Idb7a5e7ffc9e1850e9491af51ace9002e261b847
Closes-Bug: #1527605

commit_message:
Switch to setup.cfg for package configuration

Add setup.cfg with appropriate configuration settings.
Add README.rst file with short description of the repo.
Change authorship to OpenStack.
Remove obsolete code from setup.py.

Change-Id: I18347a8564c195bfb80aac772f4f7e18ce510e06

commit_message:
Force DHCP option 210 only for iPXE capable hardware

DHCP option 210 sets only for iPXE capable hardware, in other cases
used default TFTP method.

Change-Id: Id1f0d9e32487bcd902940311ed8d8bef4129fdaf
Doc-Impact: ops-guide
Closes-Bug: 1521759
Partial-Bug: 1528186
Partial-Bug: 1527474

commit_message:
Generate puppet-openstack ci docs

Puppet-Openstack ci now has docs. They are valuable
for those seting up a third-party ci system, so let's
generate them as non-voting. A follow-up patch with
publish them to http://docs.openstack.org/infra/

Change-Id: Ibf97875867438a7dd2ba9b0dae816bbd121a3e8c

This patch adds a new compute RPC API to inject an NMI to an instance.

NMI (Non-maskable Interruption) is used to trigger a special function
such as the kernel crash dump mechanism. This RPC API calls a driver
API for injecting an NMI.

Currently, the driver API for NMI is only implemented on libvirt
driver. This RPC API uses call() method for returning an error to other
driver users. Nova API layer will catch the NotImplementedError.

If new RPC version is not allowed, an error is also returned. This
patch adds the new Exception, NMINotSupported.

Change-Id: I9b649aafba011d537e3fe4eebef7a678ff6733e4
Implements: blueprint inject-nmi

This patch adds a new compute RPC API to inject an NMI to an instance.

NMI (Non-maskable Interruption) is used to trigger a special function
such as the kernel crash dump mechanism. This RPC API calls a driver
API for injecting an NMI.

If the new RPC version is not allowed, an error is also returned. This
patch adds the new Exception, NMINotSupported.

This patch uses cast() method because nothing is returned to users.
If an error happens after the rpc request is sent, instance action
will provide feedback to users.

This patch also fixes the error handling in libvirt driver.

Change-Id: I9b649aafba011d537e3fe4eebef7a678ff6733e4

commit_message:
Add a compute API to trigger crash dump in instance.

This patch adds a new API named trigger_crash_dump() to nova compute.
It calls driver.inject_nmi() to inject an NMI into the instance. And
if the instance OS is configured to use NMI to trigger kernel crash
dump, this API could trigger instance crash dump.

Change-Id: I9b649aafba011d537e3fe4eebef7a678ff6733e4
Implements: blueprint instance-crash-dump
Co-Authored-By: Hironori Shiina <shiina.hironori@jp.fujitsu.com>
Co-Authored-By: Tang Chen <tangchen@cn.fujitsu.com>

added_lines: * 1.36 - Add inject_nmi() def inject_nmi(self, ctxt, instance): """Inject an NMI to an instance in its cell. This method takes a new-world instance object. commit_message:
Add parsing of Parteds with partitions

Implemented just a basic parsing with adapter objects to do
not pollute original objects with things that are specific for
driver/parser.
Split dynamic parser into smaller files (together with tests).

Change-Id: Ia830b0861e3a7eabb3cbfee8ebb0fe4d49cb15de
Implements: blueprint volume-manager-refactoring

deleted_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import collections import copy from fuel_agent import objects from fuel_agent.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class Node(object): """Stores information from node.""" class ReferenceError(Exception): """General reference error""" class DuplicatedReferenceError(ReferenceError, KeyError): """Reference already exists""" class References(object): """Keeps references to objects""" def __init__(self): self._refs = collections.defaultdict(dict) @classmethod def _format_reference(cls, obj_type, obj_id): return '{type}/{id}'.format(type=obj_type, id=obj_id) @classmethod def _parse_reference(cls, reference): return reference.split('/', 1) def add(self, obj_type, obj_id, obj, strict=False): if strict and obj_id in self._refs[obj_type]: raise DuplicatedReferenceError( "Reference '{0}' already exists".format( self._format_reference(obj_type, obj_id) )) self._refs[obj_type][obj_id] = obj def get(self, obj_type, obj_id): return self._refs[obj_type].get(obj_id) def get_by_type(self, obj_type): return self._refs[obj_type].values() def __getitem__(self, reference): obj_type, obj_id = self._parse_reference(reference) return self.get(obj_type, obj_id) def __setitem__(self, reference, obj): obj_type, obj_id = self._parse_reference(reference) self.add(obj_type, obj_id, obj) class ParserError(Exception): """General parsing error""" class DuplicatedDeviceError(ParserError, ValueError): """Raised when device was already used""" class DynamicPartitionFormat(object): MD = 'md' def __init__(self, partition_data, node): self._raw_data = copy.deepcopy(partition_data) self._used_devices = set() self.references = References() self._node = node def is_device_used(self, device): return device in self._used_devices def mark_device_as_used(self, device): if self.is_device_used(device): raise DuplicatedDeviceError( "Device '{0}' is already used".format(device)) self._used_devices.add(device) def parse_mds(self): raw_mds = self._raw_data.get('mds', []) mds = [] for raw_md in raw_mds: md_id = raw_md.pop('id') try: md = objects.MD.from_dict(raw_md) for device in md.all_devices: self.mark_device_as_used(device) mds.append(md) self.references.add(self.MD, md_id, md, strict=True) except DuplicatedReferenceError as e: LOG.exception(e) raise ParserError( 'Duplicated ID {0} for MD object'.format(md_id) ) return mds

commit_message:
Validating user defined partition schema

PartitionSchemaValidator validates user-provided data by using
jsonschema also provided in this commit.

Other checks include:
 - device existence and duplication
 - defining volume groups on existing pvs
 - not reusing pvs
 - defining logical volumes on existing volume groups

Change-Id: I28e3ffe053c975f37323c1e43bcbe357eeeecf1a
Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Kalinowski <skalinowski@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sylwester Brzęczkowski <sbrzeczkowski@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kwiek <mkwiek@mirantis.com>

added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import copy import unittest2 from fuel_agent import errors from fuel_agent.tests import base from fuel_agent.validators import volumes as validators class TestPartitionSchemaValidation(unittest2.TestCase): @classmethod def setUpClass(cls): cls.VALID_PARTITION_DATA = base.load_fixture( 'simple_format_validator.json') def _get_partition_data(self): return copy.deepcopy(self.VALID_PARTITION_DATA) def setUp(self): self.validator = validators.PartitionSchemeValidator( self.VALID_PARTITION_DATA) def test_validation_success(self): assert self.validator.validate(self.VALID_PARTITION_DATA) is None def test_vg_pvs_ids_fail(self): invalid = self._get_partition_data() invalid['vgs'][0]['pvs'] = [40, 50] with self.assertRaises(errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError): self.validator.validate(invalid) def test_lv_vg_id_fail(self): invalid = self._get_partition_data() invalid['lvs'][0]['vgname'] = 'thereisnospoon' with self.assertRaises(errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError): self.validator.validate(invalid) def test_md_invalid_device_fail(self): invalid = self._get_partition_data() invalid['mds'][0]['devices'][0] = 'gibberish' with self.assertRaises(errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError): self.validator.validate(invalid) def test_non_existent_device_by_metadata_fail(self): invalid = self._get_partition_data() invalid['fss'][0]['device'] = '@lv/30' with self.assertRaises(errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError): self.validator.validate(invalid) def test_vgs_overlap_fail(self): invalid = self._get_partition_data() invalid['vgs'][0]['pvs'] = [1, 2, 3] invalid['vgs'][1]['pvs'] = [2, 3] with self.assertRaises(errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError): self.validator.validate(invalid)

Add volume data validation

Move ks_spaces_validation to new validation module.
Add volume data validation

Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Kalinowski <skalinowski@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sylwester Brzęczkowski <sbrzeczkowski@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Maciej Kwiek <mkwiek@mirantis.com>

Implements blueprint: volume-manager-refactoring

jsonschema from fuel_agent import errors from fuel_agent.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) KS_SPACES_SCHEMA = { '$schema': 'http://json-schema.org/draft-04/schema#', 'title': 'Partition scheme', 'type': 'array', 'minItems': 1, 'uniqueItems': True, 'items': { 'anyOf': [ { 'type': 'object', 'required': ['type', 'id', 'volumes', 'name', 'size', 'extra', 'free_space'], 'properties': { 'type': {'enum': ['disk']}, 'id': {'type': 'string'}, 'name': {'type': 'string'}, 'size': {'type': 'integer'}, 'free_space': {'type': 'integer'}, 'extra': { 'type': 'array', 'items': {'type': 'string'}, }, 'volumes': { 'type': 'array', 'items': { 'anyOf': [ { 'type': 'object', 'required': ['type', 'size', 'lvm_meta_size', 'vg'], 'properties': { 'type': {'enum': ['pv']}, 'size': {'type': 'integer'}, 'lvm_meta_size': {'type': 'integer'}, 'vg': {'type': 'string'} } }, { 'type': 'object', 'required': ['type', 'size'], 'properties': { 'type': {'enum': ['raid', 'partition']}, 'size': {'type': 'integer'}, 'mount': {'type': 'string'}, 'file_system': {'type': 'string'}, 'name': {'type': 'string'} } }, { 'type': 'object', 'required': ['type', 'size'], 'properties': { 'type': {'enum': ['boot']}, 'size': {'type': 'integer'} } }, { 'type': 'object', 'required': ['type', 'size'], 'properties': { 'type': {'enum': ['lvm_meta_pool']}, 'size': {'type': 'integer'} } }, ] } } } }, { 'type': 'object', 'required': ['type', 'id', 'volumes'], 'properties': { 'type': {'enum': ['vg']}, 'id': {'type': 'string'}, 'label': {'type': 'string'}, 'min_size': {'type': 'integer'}, '_allocate_size': {'type': 'string'}, 'volumes': { 'type': 'array', 'items': { 'type': 'object', 'required': ['type', 'size', 'name'], 'properties': { 'type': {'enum': ['lv']}, 'size': {'type': 'integer'}, 'name': {'type': 'string'}, 'mount': {'type': 'string'}, 'file_system': {'type': 'string'}, } } } } } ] } } def validate(scheme): """Validates a given partition scheme using jsonschema. :param scheme: partition scheme to validate """ try: checker = jsonschema.FormatChecker() jsonschema.validate(scheme, KS_SPACES_SCHEMA, format_checker=checker) except Exception as exc: LOG.exception(exc) raise errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError(str(exc)) # scheme is not valid if the number of disks is 0 if not [d for d in scheme if d['type'] == 'disk']: raise errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError( 'Partition scheme seems empty') for space in scheme: for volume in space.get('volumes', []): if volume['size'] > 16777216 and volume['mount'] == '/': raise errors.WrongPartitionSchemeError( 'Root file system must be less than 16T') # TODO(kozhukalov): need to have additional logical verifications # maybe sizes and format of string values

commit_message:
Added basic parsing of MDs in dynamic format

* checking for duplicated references
* checking for duplicated devices

Co-Authored-By: Sebastian Kalinowski <skalinowski@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-By: Sylwester Brzeczkowski <sbrzeczkowski@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I4168248887088cccc65c0093edcd7d7f41726c8d
Implements: blueprint volume-manager-refactoring

added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Copyright 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import collections import copy from fuel_agent import objects from fuel_agent.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class Node(object): """Stores information from node.""" class ReferenceError(Exception): """General reference error""" class DuplicatedReferenceError(ReferenceError, KeyError): """Reference already exists""" class References(object): """Keeps references to objects""" def __init__(self): self._refs = collections.defaultdict(dict) @classmethod def _format_reference(cls, obj_type, obj_id): return '{type}/{id}'.format(type=obj_type, id=obj_id) @classmethod def _parse_reference(cls, reference): return reference.split('/', 1) def add(self, obj_type, obj_id, obj, strict=False): if strict and obj_id in self._refs[obj_type]: raise DuplicatedReferenceError( "Reference '{0}' already exists".format( self._format_reference(obj_type, obj_id) )) self._refs[obj_type][obj_id] = obj def get(self, obj_type, obj_id): return self._refs[obj_type].get(obj_id) def get_by_type(self, obj_type): return self._refs[obj_type].values() def __getitem__(self, reference): obj_type, obj_id = self._parse_reference(reference) return self.get(obj_type, obj_id) def __setitem__(self, reference, obj): obj_type, obj_id = self._parse_reference(reference) self.add(obj_type, obj_id, obj) class ParserError(Exception): """General parsing error""" class DuplicatedDeviceError(ParserError, ValueError): """Raised when device was already used""" class DynamicPartitionFormat(object): MD = 'md' def __init__(self, partition_data, node): self._raw_data = copy.deepcopy(partition_data) self._used_devices = set() self.references = References() self._node = node def is_device_used(self, device): return device in self._used_devices def mark_device_as_used(self, device): if self.is_device_used(device): raise DuplicatedDeviceError( "Device '{0}' is already used".format(device)) self._used_devices.add(device) def parse_mds(self): raw_mds = self._raw_data.get('mds', []) mds = [] for raw_md in raw_mds: md_id = raw_md.pop('id') try: md = objects.MD.from_dict(raw_md) for device in md.all_devices: self.mark_device_as_used(device) mds.append(md) self.references.add(self.MD, md_id, md, strict=True) except DuplicatedReferenceError as e: LOG.exception(e) raise ParserError( 'Duplicated ID {0} for MD object'.format(md_id) ) return mds

Test https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:bug/1528308

Do not merge, we want to test:

We want to see unit tests, integration jobs and TripleO CI before
merging all patches together.

commit_message:
Simplify sed statement

This change simplify sed statement in redstack
by using subshell "$()" statement.
It reduces backslashes.

TrivialFix

Closes-Bug: #1488767
Change-Id: I119c715838b8ce45719f24e5510b0a381c2101d5

commit_message:
Allow multihomed configuration for haproxy

Bind fragment of haproxy configuration generator acts weird if given
multiple addresses instead of one. For instance, ['192.0.2.111',
'192.0.2.205'] and port 10000 would result it
'bind 192.0.2.111192.0.2.205:10000' when you expected two lines:
  bind 192.0.2.111:10000
  bind 192.0.2.205:10000

Change-Id: I0def209c0f1c9ed14e70e28cf926dc61c1a704a1
Closes-Bug: #1522589

commit_message:
tripleo.sh add option to delete overcloud

One thing we're lacking CI coverage of atm is deleting an overcloud
and proving the delete actually works, which is proving unreliable
for some users.  First step to fixing that is having tripleo.sh
support deleting an overcloud via heat, then polling until it's
done.

Change-Id: If2e1777ec4363788c0df401c3bb470254ca78a33
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/86/250486/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: set -eux echo " --overcloud-delete -- Delete the overcloud." -l,help,repo-setup,delorean-setup,delorean-build,undercloud,overcloud-images,register-nodes,introspect-nodes,flavors,overcloud-deploy,overcloud-delete,use-containers,all \OVERCLOUD_DELETE=${OVERCLOUD_DELETE:-""} OVERCLOUD_DELETE_TIMEOUT=${OVERCLOUD_DELETE_TIMEOUT:-"300"}OVERCLOUD_NAME=${OVERCLOUD_NAME:-"overcloud"} --overcloud-delete) OVERCLOUD_DELETE="1"; shift 1;;function poll_stack_status { stack_id=$1 sts=$2 timeout=$3 tstart=$(date +%s) tend=$(( $tstart + $timeout )) while (( $(date +%s) < $tend )); do if heat stack-show "$stack_id" | grep "stack_status " | grep -q $sts; then echo "Stack $stack_id reached $sts" return else sleep 10 fi done echo "Stack $stack_id never reached $sts in $timeout seconds, aborting" exit 1 } function overcloud_delete { log "Overcloud delete" stackrc_check # We delete the stack via heat, then wait for it to be deleted # This should be fairly quick, but we poll for DELETE_TIMEOUT heat stack-delete "$OVERCLOUD_NAME" heat stack-list OVERCLOUD_ID=$(heat stack-list | grep "$OVERCLOUD_NAME" | awk '{print $2}' poll_stack_status "$OVERCLOUD_ID" "DELETE_COMPLETE" "$OVERCLOUD_DELETE_TIMEOUT" log "Overcloud delete - DONE." }if [ "$OVERCLOUD_DELETE" = 1 ]; then overcloud_delete fi

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/86/260286/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Many jurisdictions have legislative and regulatory requirements governing the storage and management of data in cloud environments. Common areas of regulation include: * Data retention policies ensuring storage of persistent data and records management to meet data archival requirements. * Data ownership policies governing the possession and responsibility for data. * Data sovereignty policies governing the storage of data in foreign countries or otherwise separate jurisdictions. * Data compliance policies governing certain types of information needing to reside in certain locations due to regulatory issues - and more importantly, cannot reside in other locations for the same reason. Examples of such legal frameworks include the `data protection framework <http://ec.europa.eu/justice/data-protection/>`_ of the European Union, and the requirements of the `Financial Industry Regulatory Authority <http://www.finra.org/Industry/Regulation/FINRARules/>`_ in the United States. Consult a local regulatory body for more information. .. TODO Should there be more information on how this impacts cloud architecture design?

commit_message:
Add validation for volume_type of volume object

During copy_volume_to_image(), this tries to return
volume['volume_type'] attribute in a volume object, but
if the volume does not have a volume type, this would
trigger a db call which raise an 404 not found error.

Volume object should check volume_type_id at first and
then decide whether returning volume_type or None to
avoid VolumeTypeNotFound exception.

Also this change includes LOG.info messages fix to show
right behavior of copy_volume_to_image().

Change-Id: Id2372621962406282eece2bcbc56c242f9dff8a0
Closes-Bug: #1523362
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/14/254414/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "volume_type_id": volume['volume_type_id'], LOG.info(_LI("Copy volume to image completed successfully."),
deleted_lines: "volume_type": volume['volume_type'], LOG.info(_LI("Copy image to volume completed successfully."),

commit_message:
Optionally attach baremetal vm's to the default network

Adds an option to connect the vm's for the baremetal nodes to the
default libvirt network.  This is useful so that all traffic does not
have to be routed through the seed vm. That's desirable when testing
package based updates on the deployed baremetal nodes.

Change-Id: Iff44f44d9338b354606e9e0921d6efae763702f5

commit_message:
Add volume_extensions:quotas:delete to policy.json

Aformentioned entry was missing from default policy.json file, so the
call wasn't blocked for non-admin user. It was failing on Keystone
connection and resulted in 500 HTTP error. This addition fixes the
issue.

Closes-Bug: 1526839
Change-Id: Ib26670ea60b3e9193d91183aee35cd8aaf733068

commit_message:
Add filters using an 'in' operator

I propose to add the ability to filter the images on the properties
'id', 'name', 'container_format', 'disk_format' using the 'in' operator.

APIImpact

Implements spec-bp: in-filtering-operator

Change-Id: Ia2a00f11ba961457243fa748d51ba7c38429845a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance-specs refs/changes/71/246971/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================== Add filters using an 'in' operator ================================== I propose to add the ability to filter the images on the properties ``id``, ``name``, ``container_format``, ``disk_format`` using the 'in' operator between the values. Problem description ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Horizon sends request to get the names of the images presented in the form of ID in instances. It would be better to send an one request, and not a lot of requests. Proposed change ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ I propose to add the ability to filter the images on the properties ``id``, ``name``, ``container_format``, ``disk_format`` using the 'in' operator between the values. Alternatives ------------ None Data model impact ----------------- Modify the Image domain class to raise indexes for the ``id``, ``name``, ``container_format``, ``disk_format`` columns on the images DB table. The additional indexes raised will impose a longer upgrade window for larger Glance installs while the indexes are built. REST API impact --------------- Following the pattern of existing filters, the new filters may be specified as query parameters, using the field to filter as the key and the filter criteria as the value in the parameter. Changes apply exclusively to Image API v2 Image entity listings: GET /v2/images/{image\_id} Filter by adding optional query parameters:: id, name. disk_format, container_format An example of an acceptable criteria using an 'in' operator for name:: ?name=in:name1,name2,name3 These filters will be added using syntax that conforms to the latest guidelines from the OpenStack API Working Group, and any applicable draft guidelines [1]_. The new filters will support access control through oslo.policy enforcement to allow a deployer to restrict usage of these filters. Because these filters support this access control, no guarantee is given for availability of these filters for all API consumers. Performance or security concerns around these filters in any given deployment can be addressed through the use of custom policy rules. Standard response codes will apply when access to the filter is forbidden. Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- Update python-glanceclient as needed. Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- Update python-glanceclient as needed. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: dshakhray Other contributors: None Reviewers --------- mfedosin Work Items ---------- None Dependencies ~~~~~~~~~~~~ The appropriate indexes will also be updated on each row create and/or update to the associated image row. This is considered a minimal impact. Testing ~~~~~~~ Unit and functional tests will be added as appropriate. Documentation Impact ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Docs needed for new API filters and usage as well as the additional policy options. References ~~~~~~~~~~ .. [1] `API Working Group filtering guidelines draft <https://review.openstack.org/ #/c/177468/>`_

commit_message:
Put py34 first in the env order of tox

To solve the problem of "db type could
not be determined" on py34 we have to run first the py34 env to, then, run
py27. This patch puts py34 first on the tox.ini list of envs to avoid this
problem to happen.

Change-Id: I966264e04fbe9441d90c48645df5e6216ca0f4d5
Closes-bug: #1489059

commit_message:
Introduce a bit more flexibility by replacing .sort() -> sorted()

This will make the change in python-keystoneclient (for the sake of
displaying lots of LDAP users in Horizon, see
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/250473/4/keystoneclient/base.py) more
elegant.

Change-Id: I5857929dc86950c2321c29250ffe58bbb67f3b73
Closes-Bug: #1520668

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-10 08:08:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-midonet/commit/6e415084877b9a5f1a32b43c829127a1d4d7053a', 'message': "Clarify our use of Text(length) and explicitly restrict it to mysql

Specify Text length only for mysql.  Add a comment to explain
why we specify this long length.

SQLAlchemy mysql dialect uses the length argument of Text() to
choose a backing type.  (TEXT, LONGTEXT, ...)
However Text() usually doesn't need the length argument and
some dialects (eg. postgresql) bail out with errors when it's given.

Also, remove the length argument from the model because it doesn't

commit_message:
Clarify our use of Text(length) and explicitly restrict it to mysql

Specify Text length only for mysql.  Add a comment to explain
why we specify this long length.

SQLAlchemy mysql dialect uses the length argument of Text() to
choose a backing type.  (TEXT, LONGTEXT, ...)
However Text() usually doesn't need the length argument and
some dialects (eg. postgresql) bail out with errors when it's given.

Also, remove the length argument from the model because it doesn't
serve any purposes.  This allows us to remove a workaround in test.

Reference: http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/rel_1_0/core/type_basics.html#sqlalchemy.types.Text

Change-Id: I78ae899df080a7aa1bb78ed75d8e43a9bf75103e

commit_message:
Add alembic migrations vs. models sync test

The test is added to the unit test environment, since we do not
have a functional test job for this repo.

This test will ensure that DB migrations and models stay in sync.

The guts of code was copied from: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/214765/

Co-authored-by: Henry Gessau <gessau@cisco.com>
Closes-Bug: #1521519
Related-Bug: #1470678
Change-Id: I947a997d51d657b6a12a092fa385e4413d10ca15

commit_message:
Fix db migration script autogeneration

NOTE: You still need to exclude tables for *aas repos
and alembic_version by manually editing generated scripts.

Partial-Bug: #1522688
Change-Id: Ie4e75c86e10776318fe39fe925de8fb36fb41f6f

commit_message:
Make ./stack.sh optional

Create a new VAGRANT_KURYR_RUN_DEVSTACK environment variable to make the
`stack.sh` call optional.

Some people may want to edit the `local.conf` file before run `stack.sh`
manually in the VM. Useful for the devstack/plugin.sh development, for
instance.

It is defaulted to `true` for backwards compatibility.

Change-Id: Ia3fe8cb4416a75a3ec05cbb9ce698313daa555e4

commit_message:
Add 'ha' parameter for neutron_router

'ha' parameter allows user to set the router's type to HA or not.
If this parameter is not specified, neutron will use default value, which
depends on whether L3 HA is enabled or not.

Change-Id: I74a5e8482b5e0019e101f78ee9eafb964cf57810
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/78/260078/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Documentation for Mistral and Docker.

Purpose of this document is to explain how
to create docker image locally and how to
use it.

TODO: Update information for pre-built mistral
docker image.

Change-Id: I4e7c2e31d716fb4144484a469e30610a5cdd6f9b
Partially-implements: blueprint mistral-docker-image
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/30/257130/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Mistral And Docker ------------------ Please first refer `installation steps for docker <https://docs.docker.com/installation/>`_. To build the image from the mistral source, change directory to the root directory of the Rally git repository and run:: docker build -t <Name of image> . The Mistral Docker image is configured to store the database in the user's home directory.For persistence of these data, you may want to keep this directory outside of the container. This may be done by the following steps:: sudo mkdir /var/lib/mistral_container docker run -it -v /var/lib/mistral_container:/home/mistral <Name of image> More about docker: https://www.docker.com/

commit_message:
Enable l2population driver only when l2population is enabled

If L2 population driver is configured along with with vlan segmentation,
many port-specific processing goes through l2pop mechanism driver, while it
should not. L2 population mech driver should be disabled along with
L2 population itself.

Change-Id: I0c2122a25bd967486412e50c10f18c12ddafddc0
Closes-bug: #1527601

commit_message:
Make pci_alias parsing logic not assume device_type is set

device_type is not a required field (and it won't match a device if
it's not also set on the corresponding whitelist entries), so don't
fail with a key error if it was not set on the alias spec.

Realated-blueprint: sriov-physical-function-passthrough
Change-Id: If4cf77a5902dc063c460532020e9bee32348e765

commit_message:
Add Astara mitaka deliverables

Astara is a non:release-managed project. We just cut our m-1
tags across the 4 Astara repositories.  This adds new deliverable
files that records those as per [1].

Patches to remove version from setup.py as follows:

    * astara: https://review.openstack.org/255033
    * astara-appliance: https://review.openstack.org/255034
    * astara-horizon: https://review.openstack.org/255035
    * astara-neutron: https://review.openstack.org/255036

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/081431.html

Depends-On: Ie4a99316e60ca382f8d6323720f92ffb6642b66c
Change-Id: I52cd0e7583d224cf99922845f947824179debe7b

commit_message:
avoid metric join on resource delete

metrics on resource delete are marked as status=delete for removal
later. because of this, we don't really need to pull in metrics
when deleting resource.

Change-Id: Id083cade79c803ad291e5cf7ad966b57aa56413a

commit_message:
Misspelling in message

Misspelling in the message: "faild for %(cnt)s times!"
Should be "failed for %(cnt)s times!"
Totally 1 occasion in Ceilometer base code.

Change-Id: Ieb2513968f605e2500187784dbba3e1c8c6dcbdf

commit_message:
Move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst

For now, we have added reno for release notes management, and a folder
"releasenotes" was added in aodh. Because there is a file named
"ReleaseNotes" to provide release note location and aodh home, it will
broken some git operations in case insensitive OS (e.g. Windows).
This change simply move the content of ReleaseNotes to README.rst to avoid
the problem.

Change-Id: I30ea4a5d8cb4450ca76ec5e834ccf07cd996de77
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/aodh refs/changes/41/249041/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add test for preservation config and preconfigured deploy

Change-Id: I33c6cd26bc868138060897b381e0b804c2f7ace7
Implements: blueprint test-openstack-config-change
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/25/258825/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test(depends_on_groups=['reconfigure_ml2_vlan_range'], groups=["services_reconfiguration", "preservation_config_after_reset_and_preconfigured_deploy"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def preservation_config_after_reset_and_preconfigured_deploy(self): """Preservation config after reset of cluster and preconfigured deploy Scenario: 1. Revert snapshot reconfigure_ml2_vlan_range 2. Reset cluster 3. Upload a new openstack configuration for nova on computes 4. Deploy changes 5. Run OSTF 6. Verify nova and neutron settings 7. Create new private network 8. Try to create one more, verify that it is impossible 9. Boot instances with flavor that occupy all CPU 10. Boot extra instance and catch the error Snapshot "preservation_config_after_reset_and_preconfigured_deploy" """ self.show_step(1) self.env.revert_snapshot("reconfigure_ml2_vlan_range") self.show_step(2) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() self.fuel_web.stop_reset_env_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(3) config = utils.get_config_template('nova_cpu') structured_config_nova = get_structured_config_dict(config) self.fuel_web.client.upload_configuration(config, cluster_id, role='controller') config = utils.get_config_template('neutron') structured_config_neutron = get_structured_config_dict(config) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.wait_nodes_get_online_state( self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[:2], timeout=10 * 60) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.run_ostf( cluster_id=cluster_id) self.show_step(6) controllers = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles( cluster_id, ['controller']) structured_config = {} structured_config.update(structured_config_neutron) structured_config.update(structured_config_nova) for controller in controllers: with self.env.d_env.get_ssh_to_nailgun_node(controller) as remote: for configpath, params in structured_config.items(): result = remote.open(configpath) conf_for_check = utils.get_ini_config(result) for param in params: utils.check_config(conf_for_check, configpath, param['section'], param['option'], param['value']) self.show_step(7) os_conn = os_actions.OpenStackActions( self.fuel_web.get_public_vip(cluster_id)) tenant = os_conn.get_tenant('admin') os_conn.create_network('net1', tenant_id=tenant.id) self.show_step(8) try: os_conn.create_network('net2', tenant_id=tenant.id) except Exception as e: if 'No tenant network is available' not in e.message: raise e pass else: raise Exception("New configuration was not applied") self.show_step(9) net_name = self.fuel_web.get_cluster_predefined_networks_name( cluster_id)['private_net'] server = os_conn.create_instance(neutron_network=True, label=net_name, server_name="Test_reconfig", vcpus=2) os_conn.verify_instance_status(server, 'ACTIVE') self.show_step(10) excessive_server = os_conn.create_instance(neutron_network=True, label=net_name, server_name="excessive_VM", flavor_name="overcommit") os_conn.verify_instance_status(excessive_server, 'ERROR') snapshot = "preservation_config_after_reset_and_preconfigured_deploy" self.env.make_snapshot(snapshot, is_make=True)

commit_message:
Refactoring of tests for openstack reconfiguration

Change-Id: I569ee0106ea29ae0a9c8d50d04c74d1c729562d7
Closes-Bug: #1528153
Implements: blueprint test-openstack-config-change
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/14/258814/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @test(depends_on=[SetupEnvironment.prepare_slaves_5], groups=["services_reconfiguration", "basic_env_for_reconfiguration"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def basic_env_for_reconfiguration(self): """Basic environment for reconfiguration Scenario: 1. Create cluster 2. Add 1 node with compute role 3. Add 3 nodes with controller role 4. Deploy the cluster 5. Verify network 6. Run OSTF Snapshot: basic_env_for_reconfiguration """ snapshot_name = 'basic_env_for_reconfiguration' self.check_run(snapshot_name) self.env.revert_snapshot("ready_with_5_slaves") self.show_step(1) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.create_cluster( name=self.__class__.__name__, mode=settings.DEPLOYMENT_MODE, settings={ "net_provider": 'neutron', "net_segment_type": settings.NEUTRON_SEGMENT_TYPE, } ) self.show_step(2) self.show_step(3) self.fuel_web.update_nodes( cluster_id, { 'slave-01': ['compute'], 'slave-02': ['controller'], 'slave-03': ['controller'], 'slave-04': ['controller'] }) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id, check_services=False) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.verify_network(cluster_id) self.show_step(6) self.fuel_web.run_ostf(cluster_id=cluster_id) self.env.make_snapshot("basic_env_for_reconfiguration", is_make=True) @test(depends_on_groups=['basic_env_for_reconfiguration'], 1. Revert snapshot "basic_env_for_reconfiguration" self.env.revert_snapshot("basic_env_for_reconfiguration") @test(depends_on_groups=["basic_env_for_reconfiguration"], 1. Revert snapshot "basic_env_for_reconfiguration" 2. Apply new CPU overcommit ratio for each controller 3. Verify deployment task is finished 4. Verify nova-scheduler services uptime 5. Boot instances with flavor that occupy all CPU 6. Boot extra instance and catch the error 7. Apply old CPU overcommit ratio for each controller 8. Verify deployment task is finished 9. Verify nova-scheduler services uptime self.env.revert_snapshot("basic_env_for_reconfiguration") cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() self.show_step(3) self.show_step(4) self.show_step(5) self.show_step(6) self.show_step(7) self.show_step(8) self.show_step(9) @test(depends_on_groups=['basic_env_for_reconfiguration'], 1. Revert snapshot "basic_env_for_reconfiguration" self.env.revert_snapshot("basic_env_for_reconfiguration") @test(depends_on_groups=['basic_env_for_reconfiguration'], 1. Revert snapshot "basic_env_for_reconfiguration" self.env.revert_snapshot("basic_env_for_reconfiguration") @test(depends_on_groups=['reconfigure_ml2_vlan_range'], groups=["services_reconfiguration", "preservation_config_after_reset_and_preconfigured_deploy"]) @log_snapshot_after_test def preservation_config_after_reset_and_preconfigured_deploy(self): """Preservation config after reset of cluster and preconfigured deploy Scenario: 1. Revert snapshot reconfigure_ml2_vlan_range 2. Reset cluster 3. Upload a new openstack configuration for nova on computes 4. Deploy changes 5. Run OSTF 6. Verify nova and neutron settings 7. Create new private network 8. Try to create one more, verify that it is impossible 9. Boot instances with flavor that occupy all CPU 10. Boot extra instance and catch the error Snapshot "preservation_config_after_reset_and_preconfigured_deploy" """ self.show_step(1) self.env.revert_snapshot("reconfigure_ml2_vlan_range") self.show_step(2) cluster_id = self.fuel_web.get_last_created_cluster() self.fuel_web.stop_reset_env_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(3) config = utils.get_config_template('nova_cpu') structured_config_nova = get_structured_config_dict(config) self.fuel_web.client.upload_configuration(config, cluster_id, role='controller') config = utils.get_config_template('neutron') structured_config_neutron = get_structured_config_dict(config) self.show_step(4) self.fuel_web.wait_nodes_get_online_state( self.env.d_env.nodes().slaves[:2], timeout=10 * 60) self.fuel_web.deploy_cluster_wait(cluster_id) self.show_step(5) self.fuel_web.run_ostf( cluster_id=cluster_id) self.show_step(6) controllers = self.fuel_web.get_nailgun_cluster_nodes_by_roles( cluster_id, ['controller']) structured_config = {} structured_config.update(structured_config_neutron) structured_config.update(structured_config_nova) for controller in controllers: with self.env.d_env.get_ssh_to_nailgun_node(controller) as remote: for configpath, params in structured_config.items(): result = remote.open(configpath) conf_for_check = utils.get_ini_config(result) for param in params: utils.check_config(conf_for_check, configpath, param['section'], param['option'], param['value']) self.show_step(7) os_conn = os_actions.OpenStackActions( self.fuel_web.get_public_vip(cluster_id)) tenant = os_conn.get_tenant('admin') os_conn.create_network('net1', tenant_id=tenant.id) self.show_step(8) try: os_conn.create_network('net2', tenant_id=tenant.id) except Exception as e: if 'No tenant network is available' not in e.message: raise e pass else: raise Exception("New configuration was not applied") self.show_step(9) net_name = self.fuel_web.get_cluster_predefined_networks_name( cluster_id)['private_net'] server = os_conn.create_instance(neutron_network=True, label=net_name, server_name="Test_reconfig", vcpus=2) os_conn.verify_instance_status(server, 'ACTIVE') self.show_step(10) excessive_server = os_conn.create_instance(neutron_network=True, label=net_name, server_name="excessive_VM", flavor_name="overcommit") os_conn.verify_instance_status(excessive_server, 'ERROR') snapshot = "preservation_config_after_reset_and_preconfigured_deploy" self.env.make_snapshot(snapshot, is_make=True)

commit_message:
Add hacking rules for CLI import

In order to make Rally as a Service, rally CLI modules do not
allow to work with rally.common.db and rally.common.objects.

This patch add hacking rule to check the import of CLI module.

Change-Id: I31b53567902010182a30fc139308d17beb30bc38

added_lines: * [N355] - Ensure that CLI modules do not work with ``rally.common.db`` and ``rally.common.objects``

commit_message:
Make the script run on RedHat-like OS

A couple of slight changes to make the './devstack/plugin.sh' run on
RedHat/CentOS/Fedora machines.

Change-Id: If4141a50fc54e85b2f1eb2dec4ef25040a33c840
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr refs/changes/75/259475/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pip_install tox # CentOS/RedHat distros don't start the services just after the package # is installed if it is not explicitily set. So the script fails on # them in this killall because there is nothing to kill. # TODO(devvesa): use a `is_running service` or a more elegant approach sudo killall docker || true

subject: Don't call neutron when there is no prop_diff
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-12-01 10:13:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/e1935e2681778c6bd7717bd99c3c5205ce7f60ee', 'message': "Don't call neutron when there is no prop_diff

Current logic calls 'update_subnet' irrespective of any
change in properties(prop_diff). Also, don't send all properties
in json_snippet. Only send the ones in prop_diff.

Change-Id: I2f4f21765349d1cfffcddcb8539233ee6d8ceee9
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-12-02 03:32:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/745f1d1107500b6503d80e126d3ae0ede9256261', 'message': "Don't call neutron when there is no prop_diff

Current logic calls 'update_subnet' irrespective of any
change in properties(prop_diff). Also, don't send all properties
in json_snippet. Only send the ones in prop_diff. This fixes the
issue of subnet not being updated when update_allowed properties
are removed from the updated template.

Change-Id: I2f4f21765349d1cfffcddcb8539233ee6d8ceee9
Closes-Bug: #1521836

commit_message:
Don't call neutron when there is no prop_diff

Current logic calls 'update_subnet' irrespective of any
change in properties(prop_diff). Also, don't send all properties
in json_snippet. Only send the ones in prop_diff. This fixes the
issue of subnet not being updated when update_allowed properties
are removed from the updated template.

Change-Id: I2f4f21765349d1cfffcddcb8539233ee6d8ceee9
Partial-Bug: #1521836
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/62/251762/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: update_props['subnet']) rsrc.handle_update(update_snippet, {}, update_props['subnet']) # check with no prop_diff

commit_message:
ROM firmware is optional now

ROM firmware is optional now and should be used only by user choice.
It should be named as 'FirmwareName.isarom' placed under 'drivers/' directory.
In the same directory placed an example firmware and some information.

Change-Id: I5841deacacacf39c9c654828c44a869ef996044b
Depends-On: Id1f0d9e32487bcd902940311ed8d8bef4129fdaf
Doc-Impact: ops-guide
Closes-Bug: 1528186
Closes-Bug: 1527474

commit_message:
Add attached_volume field

In oder to connect volumes that are attached to vms
the nova field os-extended-volumes:volumes_attached is needed.
This can be useful to create policy to audit if a certain
VMs uses the right volume_types/cinder AZs.

Change-Id: Ia39871a51f433342fa2364466e5f201f2a30b7f3

commit_message:
Stop passing attr to keystoneclient when there's no filter_value

It was dropping warnings like "UserWarning: Providing attr without
filter_value to get_urls() is deprecated as of the 1.7.0 release and may
be removed in the 2.0.0 release. Either both should be provided or
neither should be provided."

Change-Id: Iead0bcf36b4a46bf465a55a33a21fd7f14f0ac40
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-swiftclient refs/changes/40/246040/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: debug = logger.isEnabledFor(logging.DEBUG) filter_kwargs = {} if 'region_name' in os_options: filter_kwargs['attr'] = 'region' filter_kwargs['filter_value'] = os_options['region_name'] endpoint_type=endpoint_type, **filter_kwargs)
deleted_lines: debug = logger.isEnabledFor(logging.DEBUG) and True or False attr='region', filter_value=os_options.get('region_name'), endpoint_type=endpoint_type)

commit_message:
Make volume_qos_client use **kwargs

As we discussed on
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-July/068864.html
All http POST/PUT methods need to contain **kwargs as their arguments.
This patch makes volume_qos_client  use **kwargs.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I28d6a86b9986e3d281e358dfe4a925d8ed8c5f21
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/64/254864/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: qos_specs = cls.volume_qos_client.create_qos( name=name, consumer=consumer, **kwargs)['qos_specs']

commit_message:
Use flavors.find interface to find flavors

This patch uses 'flavors.find' to look for flavors rather than
finding them from 'flavors.list' output.

commit_message:
This change adds the Astara Neutron driver repo.

The Astara Neutron repo contains the drivers and plugins necessary to
load into Neutron to interface with the Astara RPC API.  This repo is
being placed under Astara after considering the list conversation
regarding the Neutron Stadium [1].  Since our team will be handling
responsibility for release activities it made since to place it here.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-December/080865.html

Change-Id: Ie4a99316e60ca382f8d6323720f92ffb6642b66c
